attributes.action: Stop all future referendums from July 2016
attributes.background: Referendums cause division, animosity and pull the country apart.

attributes.action: Extend existing points immigration rules to non-Common Travel Area nationals
attributes.background: We petition parliament to extend the points based immigration system that applies to non-EU nationals to the citizens of countries outside the Common Travel Area, and make necessary adjustments to the points requirements to ensure an adequate supply of labour to the various sectors of the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Common travel area: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/common-travel-area-cta/common-travel-area-cta

Immigration rules that apply to non-EU citizens: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/immigration-rules/immigration-rules-index

attributes.action: Make it law that a 2nd referendum cant be called for 20 years after the 1st.
attributes.background: To protect the democratic purpose of a refurendum a 2nd should not be held just because people disagree with the outcome. Having the law would mean people are fully aware of the consequences of voting in the first place. Its unfair for people to cast a vote then have to worry it could be overturned
attributes.additional_details: 2014 scottish independance from the UK referendum & 2016 UK membership of the EU referendum. These are two examples where calls for a 2nd referendum should be cancelled out by law, the decision has been made and should be respected.

attributes.action: Increase the HM Government Petition Response and Action Commitment
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to recognise the scale of opinion over lawful and reasonable public interest matters with the provision of additional petition signature number milestones.
attributes.additional_details: It is proposed that a parliamentary debate is held for petitions achieving 1 million signatures and positive change is instigated for petitions achieving 10 million signatures.

attributes.action: Make voting eligible to only those who have paid PAYE tax for 5 or more years
attributes.background: Due to the backlash from the EU referendum from individuals who have no interest in what happens to the ordinary citizen and big businesses who are only interested in lining their pockets, we wish there to restrictions where only those who have paid into the country may vote for it's future.

attributes.action: Allow the youth (14-17) to vote in larger elections/referendums
attributes.background:
Big decisions affects them as well, and their future should be the prime concern at the heart of future referendums. 
At the end of the day it is there futures on the line and it would be selfish to deny them a vote.
not letting them vote would be scandalous and would cause outrage among them.
attributes.additional_details:
This is backed up by the fact that YouGov's statistics said 18-24 year olds mostly voted to remain. 
Young people are also told to voice their opinion and this would help them alot, whilst also introducing them to politics and wanting to contribute to society.

attributes.action: Make York a union with London to remain in the EU
attributes.background: York voted to remain in the EU by 58%. This is the historical capital of the North of England and was the second city until the industrial revolution. York can develop a second financial and political centre and should join London to stay in the EU.

attributes.action: Make voting be required by law from the age of 16
attributes.background: Turnouts in elections/referendums can be low meaning there are people out there not represented by the governments we elect or by the choices made in referendums - make voting be required by law, where if you don't vote you are fined (unless exceptional circumstances) and lower the voting age to 16

attributes.action: Call for a referendum in N.Ireland to decide if it remains part of the UK
attributes.background: The people of Northern Ireland have clearly decided that they want to remain a part of the European Union. Nigel Farage has lied to us, we want justice. We, the people of Northern Ireland, want to be freed. We ask that we can be allowed a referendum on the basis of our vote on the EU referendum.

attributes.action: Do not allow a second referendum on the EU to take place within the next 5 years
attributes.background: The nation has spoken and the result has been determined. Let's not change the rules after the fact.

attributes.action: Enact legislation to match EU funding for areas defined as Economically Deprived
attributes.background: Legislate guaranteeing to match (and increase in line with the Retail Price Index) current EU funding for areas defined using the EU model as Economically Deprived, post exit from the EU in 2018. This to be in addition to current levels of government investment in such areas and not replacing it.
attributes.additional_details:
This is to ensure financial promises made during the Leave campaign are not forgotten and to maintain investment and growth for the populations of such Economically Deprived areas.
E.g. The total European Regional Development Fund for the 2014-2020 funding period is €3.6bn.

attributes.action: Consider The City Of London as a free independent state. Remaining in the EU
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum decision and rumours of Scotland and Ireland. The United Kingdom has become more divided than ever. It is time for London to stand alone. We ask that the government consider the feasibility of London standing alone and remaining in the EU

attributes.action: Compulsory Voting Onile for all above the age of 14
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to implement a rule for all future referendum that voting is made compulsory for all above the age of 14 and is conducted online.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the criticality of the recent referendum the whole of the population was not represented particularly the young teenagers who are to live with this desicion for the rest of their lives. Online voting would be appealing to the young generation and would keep costs to a minimum in times of austerity.

attributes.action: Allow UK residents to vote in parliament elections and referendums.
attributes.background: After 5 years of continuous  residence people should be allowed to vote to have an influence on changes that will affect their lifes and residence in the  UK

attributes.action: Allow legal British permanent residents to vote in referendums after 5 years.
attributes.background: Not everyone living in Britain who meets the citizenship requirements wants to become a British citizen immediately. Permanent residents who have been living and working in the UK for the past 5 years should be afforded the right to vote in a referendum as it pertains to their future as well.
attributes.additional_details: A full list of citizenship requirements can be found at https://www.gov.uk/becoming-a-british-citizen/check-if-you-can-apply

attributes.action: Make UK election/referendum process compulsory in the national curriculum.
attributes.background: It is evident from many media reports after the recent EU referendum and following local/general elections, that a significant percentage of UK residents do not fully understand election/referendum processes. It reasonably follows that UK-wide education is required to remedy this.
attributes.additional_details: Too many references to mention in media of all natures including popularly watched/listened to television/radio channels and social media networks.

attributes.action: Introduce a Code of Conduct for all political advertising.
attributes.background: Since 1999 party political advertising has been outside any code of conduct and is unregulated. The content of some written and broadcast material from both sides in the recent referendum would breach the Advertising Standards Authority's code of practice if it applied to political parties.
attributes.additional_details:
To maintain freedom of expression we propose the code of conduct be applied to all written material and to broadcasts where there is no immediate ability to challenge a statement.

We petition that all statements made in both written and broadcast material meet the following criteria:
Statements implied as fact should be truthful, evidence based and responsible and not misleading or inflame or incite fear or hatred.   Statements that are based on opinion should be clearly indicated as such.

attributes.action: A referendum on whether or not parliament should endorse the Brexit vote
attributes.background: Only 51.9% of the 72% who voted supported the Brexit. The impact of Brexit will be such that the decision should not be left to this 37.368% of the electorate. This is not enough to endorse Brexit alone. An effort has to be made to ensure that a practical plan is made that the public can review.
attributes.additional_details:
This is not calling for another EU referendum. This is calling for a referendum on the consequence of the EU referendum. 

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-36616028

attributes.action: Liverpool to hold their own referendum on leaving England.
attributes.background:
Liverpool has always felt foreign and disconnected from the rest of England. In the aftermath of England leaving the European Union and Liverpool voting to remain We should have our indepence from England. 
After all the EU had done more this city in the last 20 years than anyone in Westminster.

attributes.action: Let 17 year olds vote in a 2nd EU Referendum
attributes.background: The 17 year olds in the UK should also get the chance to vote as it is our future that the older generations are deciding upon. There is a precedent for us to be able to vote, as 16 year olds were allowed to vote in the Scottish Referendum

attributes.action: Let 14-18 year olds vote in second EU referendum
attributes.background: It's their future it's affecting, let them have a say! 14-18 year olds to vote in second EU referendum!

attributes.action: Every referendum must include a 'No Confidence in the Government' option
attributes.background: The Brexit vote was 52% leave 48% remain. A very small element of protest voting against the current government could have changed the result.

attributes.action: London, Northern Ireland and Scotland to leave the UK and remain in the EU
attributes.background: London, NI and Scotland all seem to be diverging socially, economically and politically from the rest of England.  Neither they nor the rest of England can in any way claim to represent each others views, so maybe it is time to split.

attributes.action: London should be re-classified as part of Scotland in light of the EU vote.
attributes.background: In light of how the various regions voted in the EU referendum, I propose that London should be re-classified as part of Scotland. Thus enabling us to remain part of the EU if, as is likely, Scotland votes for independence from the UK.
attributes.additional_details: This would enable London's financial markets to still have the benefits of EU membership and would also strengthen the Scottish economy.

attributes.action: London to receive the same treatment as Scotland in a Vote to remain in the EU
attributes.background:
London Voted democratically to stay in with EU. Our businesses, lives and culture thrive on being a world city tolerant and thriving thanks to migration.

We voted IN! But they want to take us OUT. 

Sign this if you believe London deserves the same treatment as Scotland in its future.
attributes.additional_details: It's perfectly reasonable to propose a one country two systems format, that runs successfully in other countries, and allow London its democratic decision.

attributes.action: Ban ice cream vans
attributes.background:
Ice cream vans are a nuisance to many people with their noise day after day, especially to housebound and those bringing up children who bear an additional burden of being pestered.

They are the least regulated of any trade in Britain, allowed door to door.

Putting up with them must end.
attributes.additional_details:
"Noise from ice-cream vans can be unwanted and intrusive." South Northamptonshire Council

"Noise from ice-cream vans is unwanted, intrusive and pollutes the environment in which we live in." Neighbours from Hell in Britain 

"aggressive selling.. should be banned" Noise Abatement Society

In 2014 in New York City alone: 1,804 complaints specifically about ice cream van music.

attributes.action: We want a public database so we can see who we voted for in each election.
attributes.background: We want a transparent world and I believe being able to see who we voted for as well as our peers is a big step in this. We have the technology to do this with ease. It also makes sure that the whole system isn't corrupt.

attributes.action: Ring-fence current social service and care spending.
attributes.background: A failure to ring-fence government and local council spending on social care and services has allowed spending cuts to leave such services underfunded, and unable to meet the needs of the entire population - which can be seen in numerous failures of care for children, the elderly, and the disabled.
attributes.additional_details: Only last year adult social care regulators were reported to be receiving up to 150 reports of abuse per day - which Andrea Sutcliffe (Head of Adult Social Care) attributed to service failures, caused by underfunding. Moreover, children Trae-Bleu Layne, Rio Ross, Keanu Williams and Khyra Ishaq (four examples of many) - all died due to a lack of an organised response towards their welfare by social services - which may have been provided had funding been available to plan such a response.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for all shops and companies using job applicants as free labour
attributes.background: Make it illegal for all shops and companies using job applicants as free labour disguising it as a trial. This is wrong it gives applicants the impression that they have a job when in fact they don't. Anyone who carries out work should be paid

attributes.action: Scrap 9-1 GCSE's for the current year 10 (leaving in 2k17)
attributes.background: The current year 10 in the UK will have a mixture of letters and numbers for their GCSE's and they are having huge levels of pressure to complete the syllabus for english and maths on time and revise before sitting the exams.
attributes.additional_details: At some schools, students are stressing because they will not be able to study and revise well enough in the short period of time. If the 9-1 GCSE's are not running for the current year 10's 2k16, then it will reduce the stress of students not getting very high grades

attributes.action: we want the government to take control over BHS until a buyer is found.
attributes.background: Lots of people will loose their jobs at no fault of there own, we the HONEST and hard working feel that the government is not doing enough for these people who have dedicated their lives to this company, and as a tax payer I feel like many others that more should be done to safeguard there future

attributes.action: Make it law that every childcare setting has cctv cameras on at all times
attributes.background: My sons nursery has been closed down due to staff being accused of child cruelty. However there is no physical evidence. All childcare settings by law should have cctv in operation for the protection of children and transparency

attributes.action: Make the parliamentary select committee process similar to a civil court hearing
attributes.background: Having recently seen the parliamentary select committee for Dominic Chappell regarding BHS, it seemed all too easy for him to make unsubstantiated statements in defence of his conduct, and hide behind documents not being readily available.
attributes.additional_details: For example,  when Chappell was asked how much profit he made from BHS he did not have the answer and said he would provide it 'as soon as practicable ', this would not have happened if there was a proper process in place.  This absolutely crucial information should have been required by the committee in advance.

attributes.action: Ban Spithoods in all UK Institutions and Police Stations
attributes.background: After watching a news article about Spithoods being used on people in Pokice Custody, I was incensed at the thought of such barbaric items being used in 21st Britain. It upset me so much that i felt the need to start this petition to get them banned altogether. Just the thought of them made me ill
attributes.additional_details: These could cause a fatality in some cases especially where people suffer from claustraphobia it coukd cause asthma patients to struggle to breath and the list goes on

attributes.action: Make all use & movement of HGV during peak times; 7-9am & 3-6pm illegal.
attributes.background:
Our lives are busy. Getting the kids ready for school, working hard all day, paying our tax.
The last thing we need is to be stuck behind a lorry or in a huge queue because of a number of HGV's at the traffic lights ahead. 
Imagine how easier the commute would be without any HGV's on the road.
attributes.additional_details:
I propose we limit the amount of time the HGV drivers are allowed to drive on the road. 
I'm a HGV driver myself but I'm also in the military and must commute to work through Leicester every morning and for a reasonably small city, the traffic is ridiculous and its usually because an HGV is sat at the lights, takes 9-10 seconds to select a gear and pull away, in which time the lights are red again. 

Limiting the HGV to an off peak travel would free up our roads and limit congestion.

attributes.action: Award allied military veterans an honour 70 years after their conflict finishes.
attributes.background: France has been awarding the Chevalier in the Ordre de la Légion d’Honneur, equivalent to a British MBE, to veterans 70 years after a conflict finishes. As our veterans are now effectively ambassadors to the younger generations, British and allied veterans should be recognized in similar fashion.
attributes.additional_details:
Grand Chancery of the Legion of Honor 
http://www.legiondhonneur.fr/en

The application for the Legion D’Honneur for British Veterans
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/d-day-70-application-form-for-award-of-the-legion-dhonneur

British Legion press release: LEGION D'HONNEUR AWARD FOR D-DAY VETERANS
http://support.britishlegion.org.uk/app/answers/detail/a_id/1308/~/legion-dhonneur-award-for-d-day-veterans

attributes.action: Make it legal that there is a 2 hour minimum break per day for  live in carers.
attributes.background: Make it legally binding that all live-in care work,  though agencys ensure a 2 hour minimum break per day for carers. There should also  be a waking night carer throughout the night if necessary. carers are exploited by care agencies and private employers as there are no fixed rules for breaks
attributes.additional_details: Most live-in carers are too afraid to speak up in case they lose their job or get bad references. It is very common for carers to work up to 16 hours a day, plus getting up during the night. Most carers get paid from £65 to £95 per day and are still expected to have a happy disposition and fulfill all their duties - often without breaks. Slavery was abolished in the UK nearly 200 years ago. Please stop live in care givers being exploited  give them the voice and rights they deserve.

attributes.action: Publish the postal vote count separately at elections and referendums.
attributes.background: Given widespread concerns about the potential for electoral fraud being easier to perpetrate through postal voting than 'in-person' voting, we propose that postal votes be counted separately from the 'in-person' vote and the numbers for each count be published when the results are declared.
attributes.additional_details:
Electoral fraud is much easier to perpetrate through postal voting than voting in person as the opportunities for personation offences are multiplied significantly compared to where a person needs to present themselves at a polling station.

If there is significant variance between the two counts, any irregularities can be more easily highlighted and if necessary, investigated.

attributes.action: Reduce funding for the BBC by the production cost of the new Top Gear.
attributes.background: The new format of Top Gear does not show value for money for the UK TV Licence payer. The new format is focused on capturing the US market and the revenue it can receive. The BBC should then have the cost of the new format production reduced from it's annual funding.
attributes.additional_details: The new format of Top Gear does not show value for money for the UK TV Licence payer. The new format is focused on capturing the US market and the revenue it can receive. This is in effect is commercial TV and therefore should not have to be funded by the public purse. The BBC should then have the cost of the new format production reduced from it's annual funding until a UK audience based format is produced for the UK TV Licence payer.

attributes.action: Amalgamate all examination boards in the UK into one Government regulated board
attributes.background:
-Inaccurate marking (many re-marks go up)
-Schools play game of "picking easiest board" to improve results
-Over-burdened markers leads to poor quality
-Ambiguity of papers/questions
-Difficulty/Simplicity of papers
attributes.additional_details:
The National Association for the Teaching of English (NATE) has identified significant issues with quality of A-level marking, including, "a crisis in confidence" with exam boards.

A new book by University of Cambridge professors has sharply criticized England’s exam boards system as being “bizarre” and “untenable”.

Mick Waters, former Director of Curriculum at the Qualifications and Curriculum Agency, who says that exam boards are “diseased” and “almost corrupt”.

attributes.action: Ban the use of non-rewirable (moulded) plugs on electrical appliances.
attributes.background:
Non-rewirable plugs cannot be re-used once the appliance they are attached to is discarded. This adds to land-fill as otherwise reusable plugs are discarded with non-working appliances (fridges, kettles etc.).
Additionally, non-rewirable plugs are more hazardous to children than rewirable plugs.
attributes.additional_details:
Because non-rewirable plugs are very difficult to remove from the cables to which they are attached, they are more likely to be left on discarded cable, posing a risk to children (See: http://www.fatallyflawed.org.uk/html/other_dangers.html).

Over six million electrical items are thrown away every year in the UK (http://www.recycle-more.co.uk/pwpcontrol.php?pwpID=12809). If half of these items had non-rewirable plugs, that's three million usable plugs being discarded yearly in the UK.

attributes.action: Urgent call for Residential Care Home Act; specific to Elderly Care
attributes.background:
Respectfully, we, the signatories, ask that: 
All parties associated with residential care for the elderly are held legally responsible, therefore, legally accountable: Company Directors, Employees; Local Authority, Local Authority Commissioners, Social Services; Medical Practitioners.
attributes.additional_details:
1.  According to CARE QUALITY COMMISSION, 
18 January 2016, there is NO LEGAL REQUIREMENT for
Registered Residential Care Home Managers, Providers 
to:
- INFORM members of staff, residents, relatives, next of kin that home has been subject to an inspection by CARE QUALITY COMMISSION.
- PROVIDE COPY of CQC INSPECTION REPORT to members of staff, in their ‘mother tongue’; to residents, relatives and next of kin.

2. Recent case has revealed that, seemingly, there is 
NO LEGAL REQUIREMENT for:  
- LOCAL AUTHORITIES to maintain controls, checks and balances of commissioned residential care homes.
- MEDICAL PRACTITIONERS to maintain controls, checks, balances of administration of drugs by residential care homes.

attributes.action: Co-ordinate a crowdfund of Tata Steel interests in the UK.
attributes.background: The UK is in danger of losing it's Steel industry due to the commercial viability for it's owners, Tata Steel. It is my petition that the UK government negotiate a scrap/asset disposal price from Tata, prepare a crowd-funding campaign for the acquisition and management of these assets.
attributes.additional_details: Furthermore, the crowdfunding campaign should look to raise sufficient additional funds to give a minimum 2 year safety net for the continuation of the business based upon projected revenue streams. For more information on how to support the campaign further please get your friends, employer and any wealthy individuals that you are connected with to visit myopinionpal.com where any funds raised will be used to get more people to support this petition.

attributes.action: NHS, Fire, and Police, pay no income tax if earning below the national average.
attributes.background: My partner is a newly qualified neonatal nurse caring for seriously ill babies and as an example earns less than our postman for the same hours.
attributes.additional_details: Paying income tax means that part of their salary goes back to the NHS that employs them.

attributes.action: Offer more medical school places
attributes.background: The GMC limit the number of places avaliable for students studying medicine at university. By keeping the number of places the same, doctors numbers within the NHS won't rise putting patient care at risk. By offering more places longer term the NHS can employ more doctors and improve patient care

attributes.action: Cease/cut aid to Sierra Leone until the government amend protest laws.
attributes.background: Cease/cut aid to Sierra Leone until the government amend protest laws....
attributes.additional_details:
The Government of Sierra Leone cracks down heavily on peaceful protests. It has become illegal to protest the injustices in the country without a police clearance. This is contrary to democracy and free speech. We, the people, hardly ever get the police clearance to voice our concerns. When we do, our voices are highly censored. We face hot water canons, live ammunition and police batons if we dare to protest without a police clearance. 
The UK Government gives a significant amount of aid to the Sierra Leonean government on the basis of it practicing democratic principles. Denying us the right to protest is undemocratic in every aspect. Cutting aid funds until they revisit those provisions that suppress free speech will force them into a civil dialogue with the people they ought to serve.

attributes.action: Enact a British Bill of Rights before BrExit
attributes.background: Leaving the EU must not leave a vacuum in safeguarding human rights, employment rights and other concerns for British citizens, facing fresh challenges to freedom, rights and duties in the 21st century. No major world power functions without a clear constitution. British citizens deserve clarity,
attributes.additional_details:
Britain's unwritten Constitution: https://www.bl.uk/magna-carta/articles/britains-unwritten-constitution
The UK Constitution; A summary with options for reform: https://www.parliament.uk/documents/commons-committees/political-and-constitutional-reform/The-UK-Constitution.pdf
Crowdsourcing A UK Constitution; costs and benefits: http://blogs.lse.ac.uk/constitutionuk/2014/03/10/crowdsourcing-a-uk-constitution-costs-and-benefits/

attributes.action: Lower the sound limit of fireworks that can be sold to the public 50 decibels
attributes.background: A petition has recently gone around asking to ban the sale of fireworks to the public, and the response has been somewhat disappointing. As a compromise we are asking to lower the sound limit from 120 to 50 decibels to minimise stress on animals and people.

attributes.action: Impose economic sanctions on the USA if they renege on the Paris Climate deal
attributes.background: Climate change is an immediate threat to global ecosystems, livelihoods and communities. The Paris climate agreement is international law and must be fulfilled in order to mitigate dangerous warming. We call for economic sanctions on the USA if they withdraw from the agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
Climate change will rapidly escalate within decades unless urgent action is taken. The USA contribute 16% of global CO2 emissions and must play a leading role in fulfilling the Paris agreement. If the USA withdraw this could lead to catastrophic consequences, with the poorest people in the world suffering the most. If they withdraw, the UK should impose economic sanctions on the USA and encourage its allies to do likewise. 
www.newscientist.com/article/2112164-president-trump-means-we-cant-escape-a-dangerously-warmer-world/ www.scientificamerican.com/article/trump-picks-top-climate-skeptic-to-lead-epa-transition 
www.independent.co.uk/news/science/climate-change-game-over-global-warming-climate-sensitivity-seven-degrees-a7407881.html

attributes.action: Repeal  the Health and Social Care Bill.
attributes.background: This bill has signed the death knell for the NHS as we knew it. It has allowed private companies to cherry pick via tender the most lucrative parts of the system. This can not be allowed to continue. The NHS should be there for all.
